ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:0.5_0: The second training rule on expelsting
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with arms akimbo. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not sit with arms akimbo in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.4_0: he should not sit with arms akimbo in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with one or both arms akimbo, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk22:1.15_0: The second rule, the second training rule on fire, is finished.
